image.altText: Adelaide businessman Solomon Farah wears sunglasses and a suit as he is questioned by journalists on a city street

props.synopsis: An Adelaide businessman accused of sexually assaulting nine women over two decades has been ordered to stand trial, and lost a request to have his home detention bail conditions relaxed.

title.children: Businessman accused of sexual assault loses 'unacceptable' bail relaxation bid

image.altText: The entrance to a cave above ground

props.synopsis: After trespassers vandalised Koonalda Cave on the Nullarbor Plain a round-the-clock surveillance system was installed to help protect the nationally significant heritage site.

title.children: Cameras installed following vandalism of ancient Indigenous art

image.altText: Cattle in a pen.

props.synopsis: Australia will be subject to a 10 per cent reciprocal tariff and while Donald Trump is signalling big impacts on Australian beef, he is yet to detail just how large the tariff will be.

title.children: Australian beef singled out as Donald Trump outlines latest tariffs

image.altText: Back of a woman's head, her hair tied up in a ponytail, in a room with a display cabinet and TV on the wall

props.synopsis: Despite the growing number of adult female prisoners across Australia, advocates say there are few gender-specific support services to help them transition back into the community.

title.children: Women leaving prison are 'falling through the cracks', advocates say

image.altText: A discarded plastic bottle on sand in front of a grassy area and a blue horizon

props.synopsis: The new study by the CSIRO found polystyrene and cigarette butts are some of the most commonly found items in the environment.

title.children: Plastic pollution on Australian coastlines drops 39 per cent in a decade

image.altText: Two man sitting next to each other in a restaurant.

props.synopsis: Residents and businesses in a Victorian town hit by a major hailstorm six months ago say insurance companies are moving too slow and offering paltry payouts.

title.children: Restaurant owners with $90k hail bill offered $28k by insurer

image.altText: Koren stands in her vegetable garden, using a watering can to water seedlings in a small raised garden.

props.synopsis: Getting a handle on how and when to water can make all the difference when it comes to having a successful and fruitful garden.

title.children: Working out the best way to water helped me double my garden harvest

image.altText: Matthew Clarke, Chelsea Randall and Erin Phillips hold premiership cup

props.synopsis: Matthew Clarke makes the decision to step down as Adelaide's coach ahead of this year's AFLW season after leading the Crows to two premierships.

title.children: Dual AFLW premiership-winning coach Clarke to step away from Crows

image.altText: A pale penguin on a towel

props.synopsis: Little penguin Pearl is so rare she is first of her type seen by an academic who has been studying her species for a decade.

title.children: Rare white penguin found on SA beach in emaciated state

image.altText: A shower runs with water.

props.synopsis: The total reservoir levels across metropolitan Adelaide are at 38 per cent compared to 50 per cent at the same day last year, SA Water data shows.

title.children: Adelaide reservoir levels drop to historic lows as parts of the state experience 'pretty serious drought'

image.altText: A teenager wearing a beanie and jacket flanked by a man and woman. A selfie.

props.synopsis: Patrick, who is autistic and communicates with a letter board, says people with a disability need to be included, not "fixed".

title.children: Patrick dreams of being world's first non-speaking, autistic hiking guide

image.altText: A woman rides a mountain bike in an open space fringed with trees.

props.synopsis: It has been four years since a master plan for the Belair golf course site was abandoned following negative feedback about proposed soccer fields, but support for a mountain bike hub remains.

title.children: Renewed calls for mountain bike hub at site of former SA golf course

image.altText: A video still of a person – face unseen – approaching a small goat in a stockyard.

props.synopsis: A 21-year-old Broken Hill man has been arrested after videos apparently depicting acts of cruelty towards farm animals and native wildlife were circulated online.

title.children: Man charged with animal cruelty after videos spark outrage

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holding on to several people as he takes a tumble.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton were back on the hustings after taking the morning to respond to the latest round of Trump tariffs.

title.children: Federal election: Albanese falls off stage, Dutton is asked to clarify US remarks — as it happened

image.altText: looking down a town street with buildings from the left side of the road

props.synopsis: South Australian councils say they need more federal funding allocated as communities call for improved services ahead of the federal election.

title.children: Regional councils demand more federal cash as they pick up services

image.altText: Two glasses of red wine.

props.synopsis: It's Liberation Day in the US — a term coined by Donald Trump to signal the day the country gets its "money and respect back" by imposing tariffs on a number of international trade partners.

title.children: What Trump's tariffs could mean for Australian exports

image.altText: A man in graduation outfit.

props.synopsis: Students and union groups fear their interests could be targeted under a Coalition crackdown on "woke" ideology in schools and universities.

title.children: Free speech fears over Coalition's 'woke' education pledge

image.altText: A submarine moves through the water causing a massive wake behind it, some crew visible above deck.

props.synopsis: The United Kingdom launches a parliamentary inquiry into the AUKUS partnership, with its scope to include the "impact of geopolitical shifts" on the deal since it was signed.

title.children: Britain launches AUKUS parliamentary inquiry amid 'geopolitical shifts'

image.altText: Val Kilmer trach

props.synopsis: Four years before his death, actor Val Kilmer shared more than 800 hours of footage from throughout his life to make a moving documentary.

title.children: What we learnt about Val Kilmer's illness from his documentary

image.altText: Smartphone displaying the TikTok logo with a blurred, larger version in the background.

props.synopsis: A US ban on the platform is set to take effect on April 5 if it is not sold to an approved buyer.

title.children: Amazon makes last-minute bid to buy TikTok as deadline looms

image.altText: Kylie Truswell-Mobbs and David Mobbs smile while sitting next to each other with their heads together at a restaurant.

props.synopsis: Police will allege 50-year-old Kylie Truswell-Mobbs administered a lethal dose of prescription medication to her 56-year-old partner.

title.children: Woman charged with murdering partner with MND in 'last stages of life'

image.altText: The former foster father of Kaydence Mills holds a photo album of the toddler.

props.synopsis: Two-year-old Kaydence Mills was killed by her stepfather Tane Desatge at Chinchilla on the Western Downs in 2017 — just months after child protection services returned her to her biological mother, Sinitta Dawita.

title.children: Inquest to probe murder of toddler whose death wasn't noticed for years

image.altText: Luke Beveridge walking during the Bulldogs win over Carlton

props.synopsis: Luke Beveridge believes coaches are 'helpless' surrounding guiding players how to tackle and says even umpires are unsure on how to correctly penalise tackling in the AFL.

title.children: Bulldogs coach slams AFL rules, claims 'the whole competition is confused'

image.altText: Rescuers carry out search and rescue on damaged buildings in the aftermath of an earthquake.

props.synopsis: State-run media in Myanmar announces the military's ceasefire call, which comes after days of pressure from international aid groups and humanitarian organisations.

title.children: Myanmar military announces temporary ceasefire following earthquake

image.altText: A woman wearing Islamic dress stands on a pile of rubble and concrete after an airstrike.

props.synopsis: Gaza's health ministry says children are among the dead in an Israeli strike on a UN-run clinic in the strip's north, where people had been sheltering.

title.children: Dozens killed, tens of thousands displaced as Israel signals Gaza land grab

image.altText: A sea creature that is translucent orange being help by a hand towards the camera.

props.synopsis: From giant sea spiders to "sea pigs" and "sea butterflies" — analysing the rich biodiversity in Antarctica has thrilled researchers studying the impacts of climate change.

title.children: Scientists collect unique sea creatures during voyage to East Antarctica

image.altText: A still from a Studio Ghibli animated film showing a young girl in traditional Japanese dress.

props.synopsis: The frenzy to create Ghibli-style art using ChatGPT has sparked a heated debate about the ethical concerns of AI-generated art, copyright issues and the future livelihoods of artists.

title.children: Why the AI-generated 'Studio Ghibli' trend is so controversial

image.altText: A woman wearing a black t-shirt, standing next to a tall man, orange shirt, straw hat and eye-patch. Standing on front porch.

props.synopsis: Darwin, Australia's smallest capital city, has been ranked the country's second-most-expensive place to rent a house, along with Canberra. A local shelter says the city is in desperate need of more affordable housing.

title.children: Australia's smallest capital city has second-highest rental house prices

image.altText: A head-and-shoulders shot of Allegra Spender, in a yellow blazer with shoulder-length black hair.

props.synopsis: Independent Allegra Spender is pitching a scheme to help "permanently" cut the power bills of owners and renters through zero-interest loans for home batteries and other appliances, saying the major parties are only offering temporary relief that will expire within months.

title.children: Spender says Coalition's gas plan could influence hung parliament negotiations

image.altText: close up of a woman's blotchy face

props.synopsis: A customer suffering a severe reaction to a skincare balm says she warned Kmart a month before a teen was hospitalised.

title.children: Calls for regulation as another Kmart customer experiences skin damage

image.altText: a silhouette of a man in a wheelchair in a room

props.synopsis: Jim* moved into an apartment rented by a disability company linked to suspected NDIS fraudster Khawaja Haroon. He's now facing homelessness and has paid thousands of dollars of his NDIS funding for services he didn't receive.

title.children: 59yo's eviction linked to suspected multi-million-dollar NDIS scam

image.altText: An inner-city building that's adorned with pink and blue decorations, windows with yellow trim jutting out from the facade

props.synopsis: If you were walking down the street, could you pick a Victorian terrace from a Federation bungalow? Restoration Australia host and professor of architecture Anthony Burke walks us through five popular design eras.

title.children: Art deco to postmodern — your cheat sheet for design eras

image.altText: Peter Reith and John Howard in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: Former prime minister John Howard has always downplayed involvement in the waterfront dispute, but new evidence raises more questions about the government's knowledge of the events leading up to it.

title.children: New evidence about 1998 waterfront dispute

image.altText: A person stands looking up at large wall filled with different sized framed paintings of flowers.

props.synopsis: An impressive exhibition full of hundreds of flowers — painted, sculpted and woven into dresses — makes a powerful point about our connection to the environment, and the value of slowing down to appreciate it.

title.children: Why we turn to flowers at weddings, funerals and to decorate our underwear

image.altText: Chrishell smiles softly as she reclines on a pastel pink armchair while wearing a baby blue co-ord, hair down.

props.synopsis: The dating show Love Triangle is back for its third season, with reality royalty Chrishell Stause hosting the show's first reunion special. We catch up with the Selling Sunset star to find out why, how life's going with G Flip and what she's watching right now.

title.children: What Selling Sunset's Chrishell wishes you knew about reality TV
